results.deck: In the sixth entry in the popular horror franchise, Leon S. Kennedy is sent to investigate when the President's daughter is kidnapped by terrorists with an unclear agenda. With the game receiving a complete overhauling from previous titles, and a story unrelated to the T-virus or the Umbrella Corporation, Resident Evil 4 is one of the most lauded action games ever made.
results.name: Resident Evil 4

results.deck: Prototype is an open-world action game from Radical Entertainment. You are Alex Mercer, a human transformed by a deadly virus into a virtually invincible killing machine.
results.name: Prototype

results.deck: The fourth game in the popular Capcom action franchise, Devil May Cry. Take on the role of new playable character Nero, as he uses his swanky demon arm to beat the hell out of a demon invasion in the castle town of Fortuna.
results.name: Devil May Cry 4

results.deck: Resident Evil Zero is a prequel to the long running Resident Evil series, being set merely a day before the Mansion Incident of the original Resident Evil. Zero has players simultaneously control two protagonists: STARS Bravo member Rebecca Chambers, and escaped convict Billy Coen.
results.name: Resident Evil 0

results.deck: Gears of War is a tactical cover-based sci-fi shooter from Epic Games. The player controls Marcus Fenix, a COG soldier who fights the Locust aliens defending their home planet from the encroaching Human invaders.
results.name: Gears of War

results.deck: Galaga is a vertical shooter arcade game released in 1981. Developed by Namco and published by Namco and Midway.
results.name: Galaga

results.deck: A simple package delivery takes a turn for the bizarre in D/Generation, a 1991 action puzzle game from Robert Cook and Mindscape, Inc.
results.name: D/Generation

results.deck: A critically-acclaimed action-adventure game designed by Eric Chahi in which players assume the role of a young physicist trapped on an alien planet.
results.name: Out of This World

results.deck: A two-player fighting game that debuted in 1994. It used pre-rendered 3D characters instead of sprites and helped cement combo systems and finishing moves as fighting genre staples.
results.name: Killer Instinct

results.deck: Halo Wars is a real-time strategy game for the Xbox 360. Join the Halo Wars crew on the UNSC ship CFV-88 Spirit of Fire and engage the Covenant head-on in an attempt to hold on to the recently taken human colony of Harvest. All Units!
results.name: Halo Wars

results.deck: Resident Evil 5 follows series alum Chris Redfield as he journeys into West Africa with his new partner, Sheva Alomar, fighting Las Plagas-infested enemies called the Majini.
results.name: Resident Evil 5

results.deck: One of the longest-running first-person shooter series returns back to its brutal fast-paced roots in the fourth Doom installment.
results.name: Doom

results.deck: Grab three other knights and storm enemy forces in this downloadable 2D side-scrolling beat-em-up (complete with RPG elements, smooth drawn graphics, and online/offline multiplayer) for the Xbox 360, PlayStation 3, and PC.
results.name: Castle Crashers

results.deck: APB Reloaded is a persistent online shooter created by Real Time Worlds, developer of Crackdown, in which players are able to choose between enforcers and criminals as they duke it out in the streets of San Paro.
results.name: APB Reloaded

results.deck: The fifteenth entry in Square Enix's flagship RPG franchise, set in a world that mixes elements of modern technology with magic, a fantasy based on reality.
results.name: Final Fantasy XV

results.deck: An MMO for the PC and PlayStation 3 that allows you to fight for and alongside the forces of good or evil from the DC Comics Universe.
results.name: DC Universe Online

results.deck: Final Fantasy Type-0, formerly Final Fantasy Agito XIII, is an RPG for the PSP. The PSP Version was only available in Japan, but an Xbox One and Playstation 4 version was localized for North America & Europe.
results.name: Final Fantasy Type-0

results.deck: Direct sequel to Killer Instinct. Released in 1996 for the arcades. Published by Midway and Nintendo. Developed by Rare Ltd.
results.name: Killer Instinct 2

results.deck: Roblox is a free Massive Multiplayer Online Game, where you play in user-created worlds with blocks and physics.
results.name: ROBLOX

results.deck: A Boy and His Blob, a two-dimensional puzzle-platformer has been referred to as "inspired by" and a "rebirth" of the now twenty-year-old original rather than a straightforward remake.
results.name: A Boy and His Blob

results.deck: Ultratron began as an XNA Xbox Indie game and was rebuilt for a full release on Steam. It's a futuristic dual-joystick shooter. Curve Studios is bringing the full version to new consoles in early 2015
results.name: Ultratron

results.deck: Developed by Eidos Montral and coming more than 10 years after the previous Thief game, this is the fourth installment in and a reboot of the Thief franchise.
results.name: Thief

results.deck: Reluctant hero Jason Fleming investigates a hidden underground complex to rescue his girlfriend Claire in this Metroid-style action-adventure game.
results.name: Shadow Complex

results.deck: Trials HD is a 3D, physics-based motorcycle racing/platforming game played out on a 2D plane.
results.name: Trials HD

results.deck: A reboot of the previously singleton franchise, this game features Faith using parkour in an open-world.
results.name: Mirror's Edge Catalyst

results.deck: A young and inexperienced Lara Croft is shipwrecked on a mysterious island in this reboot of the beloved action adventure franchise, departing from the mood of prior games in the series.
results.name: Tomb Raider

results.deck: A remake of the first game in the pre-eminent video game horror series, featuring a graphics overhaul, as well as several new gameplay features, environments, and unlockable modes that weren't included within the original version.
results.name: Resident Evil

results.deck: Black Wing Foundation is developing third-person shooter Scivelation for the next generation of gaming consoles.
results.name: Scivelation

results.deck: Syberia III is the upcoming sequel to adventure games Syberia and Syberia II.
results.name: Syberia III

results.deck: An old school styled driving game inspired by the original GTA 1 and 2, but now with zombies.
results.name: Zombie Driver

results.deck: Originally known as "Black Lotus", and then "True Crime: Hong Kong", Sleeping Dogs is an open-world action game that tells the story of undercover cop Wei Shen as he infiltrates the ranks of the murderous Triads in Hong Kong.
results.name: Sleeping Dogs

results.deck: Players return to the post-Apocalypse in the sequel to 2010's Darksiders, this time as former protagonist War's fellow Horseman of the Apocalypse, Death, the pale rider, who seeks to resurrect Humanity to clear his brother's good name.
results.name: Darksiders II

results.deck: A little boy seeks to rescue his lost sister from a dreary, dangerous world in this puzzle-platformer that kicked off the Summer of Arcade in 2010.
results.name: Limbo

results.deck: A procedurally-generated game of world exploration, resource harvesting, and freeform construction. It supports local and online multiplayer, and is regularly updated with new content and features.
results.name: Minecraft

results.deck: A first-person action-RPG based heavily around spellcasting. The first game from independent developer Xaviant, and one of the first titles to use CryEngine 3.
results.name: Lichdom: Battlemage

results.deck: World of Tanks is a free-to-play (F2P) massively multiplayer online (MMO) team based action game featuring WWII era tank combat.
results.name: World of Tanks

results.deck: Set in ancient Rome circa 68 A.D, this third-person action game follows Marius Titus as he sets out to avenge his fallen family. Developed by Crytek as an exclusive Xbox One launch game.
results.name: Ryse: Son of Rome

results.deck: Jet Car Stunts was originally released in 2009 on the iPhone, but has since seen release on most other platforms.
results.name: Jet Car Stunts

results.deck: A free-to-play MMORPG inspired by R.A. Salvatore's Neverwinter Saga book trilogy.
results.name: Neverwinter

results.deck: Pinball FX2 is a free shell for downloadable pinball tables. The tables are sold individually or in packs of four.
results.name: Pinball FX2

results.deck: Infinity Blade is the first iOS game to use the Unreal Engine. The game pits players against a variety of massive foes on a quest to slay the God King.
results.name: Infinity Blade

results.deck: A quasi-sequel to From Software's action-RPG Demon's Souls, set in a new universe while retaining most of the basic gameplay and the high level of challenge. It features a less-linear world, a new checkpoint system in the form of bonfires, and the unique Humanity system.
results.name: Dark Souls

results.deck: This spiritual successor to Panzer Dragoon was released on November 22, 2013 exclusively on the Xbox One.
results.name: Crimson Dragon

results.deck: A 2D indie puzzle platformer developed by Facepalm Games. It explores the concept of identity; the fuzzy line between mind and body. The player controls an astronaut with a mysterious device called The Swapper which allows them to make clones and swap between them.
results.name: The Swapper

results.deck: The sequel to Radical Entertainment's 2009 ultra-violent sandbox game, Prototype 2 returns to an urban landscape ravaged by an all-consuming virus.
results.name: Prototype 2

results.deck: The fifth installment in Bethesda's Elder Scrolls franchise is set in the eponymous province of Skyrim, where the ancient threat of dragons, led by the sinister Alduin, is rising again to threaten all mortal races. Only the player, as the prophesied hero the Dovahkiin, can save the world from destruction.
results.name: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

results.deck: Presenting an original story in the same franchise as the comic book series of the same name, The Walking Dead is a five-part adventure game from Telltale that follows the story of a convicted murderer, his guardianship over a young girl, and his co-operation with a roaming group of survivors in a zombie apocalypse.
results.name: The Walking Dead

results.deck: A prequel to the Fables comic book series, The Wolf Among Us tells a tale of the reformed Big Bad Wolf of childhood folklore (who is the sheriff of a secluded community of fables in 20th century New York City) as he investigates a series of grisly murders.
results.name: The Wolf Among Us

results.deck: The sequel to Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket-Powered Battle-Cars, Rocket League is the second vehicular sports-action game developed by Psyonix.
results.name: Rocket League

results.deck: Hawken is a free to play, multiplayer-only first-person shooter featuring enormous mechs and micro-transactions from independent studio Adhesive Games.
results.name: Hawken

results.deck: Terraria adds upon its inspiration with a wider variety of things to create, unique enchanted items, and an overall goal of descending into Hell and defeating the sinister bosses lurking there.
results.name: Terraria

results.deck: Rescue yourself from your inexplicable demise in this 2D platformer from tinyBuild.
results.name: No Time to Explain

results.deck: Dragon Age: Inquisition is the third installment in the Dragon Age series of role-playing games developed by BioWare.
results.name: Dragon Age: Inquisition

results.deck: A first-person survival horror game in which the player must survive the undead plague in London. If one survivor becomes infected, the player takes on a new one and has to kill their former self to get their stuff back.
results.name: ZombiU

results.deck: After the Empress is killed, her most loyal bodyguard, Corvo, becomes the prime suspect, and must track down those who murdered his charge and betrayed him in order to enact his bloody revenge.
results.name: Dishonored

results.deck: In this sequel to the indie classic, Octodad returns, to live an idyllic life with his wife and children that would be absolutely perfect aside from the fact that he's an octopus. Fortunately, thanks to his clever disguises, nobody suspects a thing...
results.name: Octodad: Dadliest Catch

results.deck: The Swindle is a physics-based platformer where you infiltrate facilities and steal their money.
results.name: The Swindle

results.deck: Shoot your way across the solar system to level up and collect new loot in this multiplayer-focused first-person shooter from Bungie and Activision.
results.name: Destiny

results.deck: A space sim game featuring transformable mecha.
results.name: Strike Suit Zero

results.deck: A free-to-play MOBA game from the developers of Global Agenda and Tribes Ascend. Smite is played entirely in third person camera and every spell and attack is a skillshot.
results.name: Smite

results.deck: A 2D side-scrolling shooter developed by Oxeye Game Studio and published by Mojang AB.
results.name: Cobalt

results.deck: AirMech is a real-time strategy game that puts players in the world as a robot that can turn into a jet.
results.name: AirMech

results.deck: Players create their own rockets from a variety of parts and then attempt to launch them into space.
results.name: Kerbal Space Program

results.deck: The sequel to Kaos Studios' 2011 shooter debuts an open-world and a Korean-occupied Philadelphia amid resistance.
results.name: Homefront: The Revolution

results.deck: Grand Theft Auto V is a modern crime epic featuring a crew of three protagonists rolling through the diverse landscape of the fictional state of San Andreas.
results.name: Grand Theft Auto V

results.deck: A downloadable shell for playing virtual recreations of the most famous (and infamous) pinball tables by the largest manufacturers of pinball machines in history.
results.name: The Pinball Arcade

results.deck: When invading aliens capture the Saints and imprison their minds in a digital recreation of Steelport, it's up to the Boss (who by now has become the President of the United States) to free Earth from its oppressive new overlords.
results.name: Saints Row IV

results.deck: An Ouya and PC action game developed by a Spanish studio that hearkens back to Ghouls N' Ghosts and other "Nintendo hard" side-scrolling action games of the late-80s, early-90s.
results.name: Maldita Castilla

results.deck: An Obsidian-developed role-playing game based on the South Park animated TV series, in which players control a new kid in the eponymous town of South Park and takes part in an epic pretend-fantasy story that threatens the entire town.
results.name: South Park: The Stick of Truth

results.deck: Project CARS (short for Community Assisted Racing Simulator) is a community funded racing simulator developed by Slightly Mad Studios, the developer of the Need for Speed: Shift series.
results.name: Project CARS

results.deck: The third game in the Warriors Orochi series featuring 120 playable characters from a multitude of Tecmo Koei franchises.
results.name: Warriors Orochi 3

results.deck: The technically eighth entry in the popular horror series features the return of leading protagonists Leon S. Kennedy and Chris Redfield, along with new character Jake Muller, to combat against the latest B.O.W. manufacturer Neo-Umbrella.
results.name: Resident Evil 6

results.deck: In this pixel-styled retro shooter from the makers of "Superbrothers: Sword & Sworcery EP", an elite team of totally extreme heroes called the Super T.I.M.E. Force must travel through time and use heavy firepower and the ability to manipulate time to overcome their enemies.
results.name: Super Time Force

results.deck: The Sun has stopped in the middle of the sky, the Gods have died and human settlements are being invaded by the Dredge, a race of stone beings. There can be no doubt about it, the world is coming to an end. In this turn-based tactics game, borrowing elements from Norse myth, your clan's continued survival is the only thing that truly matters. Will its banner be stomped into the the ground or fly high and bring back hope to those who have lost it in this desolate cold world?
results.name: The Banner Saga

results.deck:
A game developed by a small independent company called Compulsion Games.

A puzzle platformer that plays with shadows and mixes 3D with 2D perspectives.
results.name: Contrast

results.deck: Brian Fargo, Alan Pavlish, Mike Stackpole and others reunite for a sequel to their hit 1988, post-apocalyptic CRPG Wasteland. Wasteland 2 is fan-funded from a successful Kickstarter campaign.
results.name: Wasteland 2

results.deck: A sidescrolling action-adventure that takes inspiration from Super Metroid and other "Metroidvania" games. The player controls Trace, a scientist who finds himself in a strange, foreign world.
results.name: Axiom Verge

results.deck: The first free-to-play game for the Xbox 360 (via Xbox Live Arcade) has two cutesy teams brutally facing off by capturing spawn points and sieging each other's castle.
results.name: Happy Wars

results.deck: Rayman Legends is the sequel to 2011's Rayman: Origins.
results.name: Rayman Legends

results.deck: Yatagarasu is an independently developed 2D fighting game featuring efforts from three ex-King of Fighters developers.
results.name: Yatagarasu

results.deck: An MMORPG set in the world of Nirn, focusing on the familiar continent of Tamriel, taking place a thousand years before The Elder Scrolls: Skyrim.
results.name: The Elder Scrolls Online

results.deck: An action role-playing video game developed by NeocoreGames.
results.name: The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing

results.deck: A first-person interactive experience revolving around exploration and discovery in a residential locale.
results.name: Gone Home

results.deck: Rising to prominence through the American fighting game community, Divekick is an indie fighting game that distills the controls into two simple buttons, requiring  clever strategy as players try to score the first hit with their divekick attack!
results.name: Divekick

results.deck: Divinity: Original Sin is a top-down turn-based RPG developed by Larian Studios. It introduces new elements to the franchise, such as co-op gameplay and decision-making as well as a more interactive world.
results.name: Divinity: Original Sin

results.deck: A first-person horror game played from the perspective of a two-year-old child. Players will confront creatures and environments that straddle the line between real and surreal.
results.name: Among The Sleep

results.deck: Defend your pre-built castle while laying siege on your opponent's using a variety of different units (including your hero, your ballista, and some troops) and powerful spells in this side-scrolling action real-time strategy game.
results.name: CastleStorm

results.deck: Human Element is the first game from Robotoki. It is about zombies and survival. The game is on hiatus as of January 20, 2015.
results.name: Human Element

results.deck: LocoCycle is an Xbox One launch title from Twisted Pixel Games. Players control I.R.I.S., an experimental motorcycle on the run from Big Arms, a division of Big Science.
results.name: LocoCycle

results.deck: A third-person open-world game from Ubisoft, set in a dark alternate version of the US where corporations track and catalog all online behavior over a vast data network. A vigilante group called the Watch_Dogs hacks into this data, using it to hunt criminals.
results.name: Watch Dogs

results.deck: An adventure game in the same vein as Ico or The Dig, Lifeless Planet tells the story of an anonymous astronaut who is transported to a faraway planet with no way to return to Earth, only to discover the remains of an extensive Soviet-era facility.
results.name: Lifeless Planet

results.deck: With the help from the CRIMENET underground criminal network, the Payday crew don their masks once again for a new epic crime spree in Washington, D.C.
results.name: Payday 2

results.deck: A free-to-play, third-person action shooter developed by Digital Extremes.
results.name: Warframe

results.deck: An indie minimalist puzzle platformer.
results.name: Thomas Was Alone

results.deck: Telltale's continuation of the Back to the Future story.  It contains 5 episodes.
results.name: Back to the Future: The Game

results.deck: A rhythm game - fighting game hybrid for PlayStation 3, Vita, and PC
results.name: KickBeat

results.deck: Sequel to the first Defense Grid game, released following a successful Kickstarter campaign.
results.name: Defense Grid 2

results.deck: Break the fourth wall in this 3rd person action game, the first headlined by "The Merc With A Mouth" Deadpool.
results.name: Deadpool

results.deck: Reconsider the laws of physics in this 2D puzzle game.
results.name: The Bridge

results.deck: DICE's popular multiplayer-focused shooter series continues, making its debut appearance on the PS4 and Xbox One.
results.name: Battlefield 4
